medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening morning and daytime headaches in the occipital area that radiated over the cranium.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 2 years ago and have progressively worsened over time. She also described intermittent paresthesia in her hands and feet, which was of variable distribution and duration. Factors that have aggravated or relieved the symptoms are not specified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was otherwise healthy with no other known medical problems. She smoked cigarettes.
medical_history.family_history: Lipomatous medulloblastoma was diagnosed in the patient's maternal grandfather, who died from the disease. A maternal uncle underwent resection of a supratentorial liponeurocytoma and was alive at the time of writing. The patient's mother had a posterior fossa tumor diagnosed as lipomatous medulloblastoma and was alive and free of active disease at the time of writing.
medical_history.social_history: The patient smoked cigarettes but had no other lifestyle factors or habits mentioned.
